title: 3 easy tips to help stay healthy during back to school from Pretty Prudent
description:
As her youngest starts kindergarten, blogger Pretty Prudent shares with us her top tips for helping stay healthy during back to school. 
Every year kids miss 22 million school days due to illness†, but Lysol® Disinfectant Spray and Lysol® Disinfecting Wipes kills 99.9% of germs, including 8 common cold & flu viruses* to help protect your home and family, so that back to school doesn't have to mean back to germs. 
*When used as directed
†CDC ‘Vital Health and Statistics. Current Estimates from the National Health Interview Survey, 1996.’; Published October 1999.

asset.author: Lysol
asset.description:
As her youngest starts kindergarten, blogger Pretty Prudent shares with us her top tips for helping stay healthy during back to school. 
Every year kids miss 22 million school days due to illness†, but Lysol® Disinfectant Spray and Lysol® Disinfecting Wipes kills 99.9% of germs, including 8 common cold & flu viruses* to help protect your home and family, so that back to school doesn't have to mean back to germs. 
*When used as directed
†CDC ‘Vital Health and Statistics. Current Estimates from the National Health Interview Survey, 1996.’; Published October 1999.

transcripts: Lysol and pretty prudent present tips to help stay healthy during back to school. Our youngest Gordon is off to kindergarten and how did these past five years fly by sending a child off to his first year of elementary school can be sad but also joyful as long as you don't think too much about all the new germs he'll encounter on a school adventures. Children miss 22 million school days every year due to illness but with a few smart drum fighting measures added to our daily routine we can keep our kids healthy happy and in the classroom wash hands frequently kids love to touch everything frequent hand-washing helps get rid of most germs before they have a chance to settle in and become an illness disinfect and sanitize trouble spots with Lysol it's easy for unwanted germs and bacteria to travel home from school with a new student like Gordon disinfect high-traffic touch spots at home with lysol disinfecting wipes don't forget to also tackle items that come back and forth from school schedule a flu shot the common cold is annoying to say the least but the flu can keep your kiddo out of school for weeks make an appointment to get vaccinated as soon as it's available each year, mom too that's a school doesn't have to mean back to germs.
